intro: Lellingeria paucipinnata, commonly known as the few-pinnate sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or brownish in color. This plant is often found in wet or moist environments such as marshes and swampy areas. Lellingeria paucipinnata is native to parts of Africa and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
